str2: Offspring, child, fruit. From gennao; offspring; by analogy, produce.
A serpent, snake, viper. Of uncertain origin; an adder or other poisonous snake.
Adverb from the base of pou; an interrogative particle of manner; in what way?; also as exclamation, how much!

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
str2: (a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can. Of uncertain affinity; to be able or possible.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Abundance, overflow. From perisseuo; a surplus, or superabundance.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The mouth, speech, eloquence in speech, the point of a sword.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolonged form of an otherwise obsolete verb; to talk, i.e. Utter words.
